criteria: Understanding of the Reproductive System as a Whole
descriptions: The student does not identify any major reproductive organs or identifies them incorrectly.
The student identifies only 1 major reproductive organ correctly.
The student identifies 2 major reproductive organs correctly.
The student identifies most major reproductive organs (3-4) correctly, with some minor errors.
The student identifies all major reproductive organs correctly.
The student identifies all major reproductive organs correctly and provides additional relevant details about their location or development.
The student provides no description of organ structure.
The student provides a very vague or inaccurate description of the structure of one reproductive organ.
The student describes the structure of at least one reproductive organ with some accuracy.
The student accurately describes the structure of several (2-3) reproductive organs, but may miss key details.
The student accurately describes the structure of most major reproductive organs, including key details.
The student accurately and thoroughly describes the structure of all major reproductive organs, including how the structure relates to function.
The student does not explain the function of any reproductive organs.
The student provides a vague or inaccurate explanation of the function of one reproductive organ.
The student explains the function of at least one reproductive organ with some accuracy.
The student accurately explains the function of several (2-3) reproductive organs, but may miss key details or connections.
The student accurately explains the function of most major reproductive organs, including key details and how they interrelate.
The student accurately and thoroughly explains the function of all major reproductive organs, including their interrelationships and hormonal controls.
The student demonstrates no understanding of how the different parts of the reproductive system work together.
The student shows a limited understanding of how one or two parts of the reproductive system relate to each other.
The student begins to connect the function of a few different organs in the reproductive system.
The student explains how several key organs in the reproductive system interact.
The student demonstrates a strong understanding of how the major parts of the reproductive system work together to achieve reproduction.
The student provides a comprehensive explanation of the reproductive system, including hormonal regulation, feedback loops, and the influence of external factors.
